result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessica J Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting-Special Facts, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Theft-Business Setting-Special Facts, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Theft-Business Setting-Special Facts, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

The Court orders that: Upon deposit of $200.00 and current address information, the Defendant be released from custody, on the above mentioned case(s).  The Defendant shall pay the remaining balance, plus interest and a $15.00 payment plan fee, at the rate of $50.0/mo. commencing 05/15/2016.  25% annual increase of monthly payments shall be implemented.  The civil judgment and referral to WI DOR, if applicable, shall remain. Any failure to comply with this order shall result in the re-imposition of the failure to pay sentence without further notice of hearing.

Case called at 11:50 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Jessica J Rodriguez in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim Rights Compliance Verified by ADA Shock; Court so finds - Victim is here for hearing with restitution request

On Restitution: 
ADA Shock indicates that do believe there is an agreement with Defense that the amount of restitution owed is $4142.03, but is issue on ability to pay
Statements by Kirk Dys
Atty Rhiel informs the Court that they agree to $4142.03 restitution
Court finds that the amount of $4142.03 is the total sum of restitution owing, payable to Mildred Meudt

On Ability to Pay: 
Jessica Jane Rodriguez--sworn & testifies
--direct exam by Atty Rhiel 
--Statements by Mr. Dys
--exam by the Court
--redirect exam by Atty Rhiel
Court finds that over the course of 3 years, the Defendant has the ability to pay entire sum of restitution.
Appeal Rights Given

Court orders delay of jail term for 8 weeks - Jail term to commence on July 3, 2015 at 7:00 am

Case called at 8:15am [mo] 
Defendant Jessica J Rodriguez appears via telephone. Her attorney John Vernon Rhiel appears in court.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Rhiel requests a stay of Ms. Rodriguez's jail term, related to the current hospitalization of Ms. Rodriguez. 
ADA Hall voices concerns about the stay of the jail term, including that the State has learned that Ms. Rodriguez has been telephoning the victim.
The Court grants the Defense's request for stay of conditional jail time for 45 day time length.
recess: 8:27am

NEXT:  Review Hearing May 5, 2015 at 11:00am
Court orders temporary stay of jail term
Hearing on March 24, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Case called at 11:12 am  [sf]
Defendant Jessica J Rodriguez in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel. ADA Jeffrey Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Shock adivses the Court that the parties have a partial agreement on restitution.
recess: 11:15 am
reconvene: 11:17 am
ADA Shock files an Amended Information 
Service of Amended Information admitted; reading of entirety of the Amended Information waived

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Counts 1, 3 & 4 of the Amended Information; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered knowingly, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2.

On each count, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:
--On Count #1, to serve 6 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work release privileges; to commence FORTHWITH
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--Any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety; no presence in bars or taverns
--Monthly testing for illegal drug use
--DNA sample 
--Contact with Mildred Meudt is to be with prior approval and under the strictures of the Agent 
--To pay costs of $268 each count
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge each count

Court presents basis and will set aside the remainder of the sentencing hearing as is relates to restitution and to credit.

recess: 12:27 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be Mailed)
Restitution Hearing: within 60 days (Court charges Attorney Rhiel with getting a date from the JA that works for both parties, by either close of business today or Monday) (JA please note that appeal rights still need to be given)
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 20, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Scheduling notice

* FINANCIAL RECORDS *
Preliminary hearing on October 3, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 1:45 pm
Defendant Jessica J Rodriguez in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek  from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office (PD will appoint counsel). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charge and maximum penalties recited
Court finds that the criminal complaint states probable cause.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $250.00 CASH bond, with conditions: 
-No contact with Mildred Meudt, Kirk Dys and Karen Dys 
-No presence at 221 Maple Grove Circle Jefferson

Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 20 day time limit. Attorney Svehlek requests that a Preliminary Hearing be set within 10 days. 
Court orders that a Preliminary Hearing will be set beofre 10 days if the Court's calendar allows it.

Recess: 1:59 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Preliminary Hearing: 10/3/14 at 9:00 am
